p: Some of the hypotheses raised so far may clarify the relationship between COVID-19 and ischemic events [ 4]. Together with the exacerbated inflammation, other factors such as hypoxemia, immobilization, and, in some cases DIC, culminate in a prothrombotic state. Therefore, it can precipitate type-1 AMI, related to instability of the atherosclerotic plaque, leading to coronary thrombosis and subsequent infarction [ 16, 17]. NeverthelessÂ , when compared to patients hospitalized with severe pneumonia due to other etiologies, individuals infected with SARS-CoV-2 have greater thrombophilia, which raises questions about the other mechanisms [ 17].
